name: Novotel Reims Tinqueux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not a lot to add to previous reports.My wife and I used the hotel for an overnight stay on our way to Austria.Perfectly good room-clean,modern and well equipped.Surprisingly good meal on a sunday night.Nice bar.Efficient friendly staff.Only downside is the surroundings but having said that it is ideally placed for hopping on and off the autoroute.
reviews.title: Fine for an overnight stay
Good Overnight Stop Or Short Break.
reviews.text: Have stayed here many times over the years and it is still a very pleasant place to stay. Staff are extremely friendly and there is a good atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasant Novotel rooms with decent beds. Rooms were spotless (we had two).
reviews.title: try to find somewhere more interesting

reviews.text: Dinner in the restaurant was well cooked with excellent service.
reviews.title: Excellent for an onvernight stay

likes.liked: — Friendly, welcoming staff and ease of access from autoroute.
likes.disliked: — Hard to fault, but I's stay in Reims or Epeynay centre next time as this hotel has little nearby.

reviews.text: Rather than pay the rather pircey rate for breakfast, walk across the car park to the Ibis and try their cheaper, light fare.
reviews.title: looks may deceive

reviews.text: We mostly use Novotel hotels when travelling in France and the one at Tinqueux outside Reims has been one of our better experiences. The refurbished airconditioned rooms with separate shower cabin, separate toilet and the usual Novotel sleeping arrangement (one big bed, one sofa which can be turned into a very comfortable bed) are very comfortable. Breakfast great as in all Novotels, staff very friendly, swimming pool most welcome in this hot weather. Reims itself is a nightmare right now because of the construction of a new tram - just stay at the hotel and enjoy its amenities. When you leave, you are right on the motorway A4, A29. There is a Chinese restaurant just behind the hotel - avoid it at all cost!
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel

reviews.text: On arrival one of our 'non smoking' connecting rooms had just been smoked in by the previous occupant. They had put the cot in that one!
reviews.title: Very poor food and poor and unfriendly/rude service to match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in the early afternoon and our room was not ready as they were still cleaning it and vacuuming. While we were waiting for ten to fifteen minutes our three children (10,8,2) were playing in the hall at the end of the corridor - it had a small table with lego provided for that purpose.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once our room was ready we made our way in immediately and had been in there only ten minutes when the lady from reception knocked on our door with a complaint about the noise our children were making. She had just checked us in so she knew we were English, and she spoke to us in perfect English at reception - now she had a complaint she spoke only in French, as clearly the complainant was French and she was more worried about appeasing them than allowing us to have an undisturbed rest following six hours of non-stop driving in the morning.
reviews.title: Good stop-over hotel close to Rheims

reviews.text: I found this behaviour unbearably rude but fortunately I understood what she said - one of our 'neighbours' was trying to 'sleep' - well it was early afternoon and they had just been vacuuming on our floor for who knows how long, but obviously some English children were much more annoying and louder than a 100db vacuum.
reviews.title: It does what it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently situated, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the staff competent. The hotel is on two floors and has pleasant gardens (where small rabbits played). This gave the hotel a cosy feel despite its size. We had a room towards the back (near door 3) which meant a long walk to/from reception and the restaurant.
reviews.title: Mostly pleased, but really missed our tea!

likes.liked: — Easy access, spacious rooms, good beds

reviews.title: Excellent for a short stay
reviews.text: There was however no in-room kettle. We really like our tea first thing in the morning - we even bring our own tea bags, because we do not like the insipid Lipton that seems to be available in most European hotels. We could have had just such Lipton tea from room service but didn't fancy it. I know not everyone likes tea, but at least one in three of the cars parked in the hotel car park had a British registration number. Surely a hotel of this class can cater for the British taste of tea by providing a kettle or coffee/tea maker in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was mostly ok with a large choice of fare. The hot food (bacon and scrambled egg) was rather watery though.
reviews.title: easy to find, ask for the premier rooms

description: The Novotel Reims Tinqueux is located right near the exit from A4 and A26 motorways, 10 minutes from the centre of Reims and the TGV Est train station, an ideal location for a business trip to Reims or the Champagne region. This 3 star hotel offers 127 soundproof airconditioned rooms, 525 sqm of modular meeting rooms for your next function or seminar in Reims and a free 200 space car park. Unwind in our bar and restaurant overlooking the terrace and the swimming pool.
